messages: c02048e82d3d496856ed9481b4012c35 (04:21): is the hardware support for x86 not very good?

7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (04:26): the hardware that is supported runs excellently and will not fail unexpectly because of bugs.   When hardware is supported by solaris it is not becasue some one took an hour or to make a drive that works some of the time and crashes the kernel others.  if sun says its supported it will work as expected
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (04:27): if your nic isn't supported go spend $20 on ebay and get a high quality replacement, easy as that  same with your video card.
8c27c6238210e78d0cff9690db08116b (04:35): linux_user400354, what kind of damn fool would use X86?

c02048e82d3d496856ed9481b4012c35 (04:37): ill get solaris installed if it takes a week

c02048e82d3d496856ed9481b4012c35 (04:38): solaris can run with virtual hardware
c02048e82d3d496856ed9481b4012c35 (04:39): vmware server in linux will run solaris just fine

7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (04:39): yes i'm aware of this fact as does most people here
c02048e82d3d496856ed9481b4012c35 (04:39): solaris might not like real hardware. ill use virtual hardware if i have to.

f97ed93c1ad24e1e1c7ed3dcc2b0e407 (04:57): hi! is there an official reference guide or table of features and commands available in each SunOS/Solaris version?
f97ed93c1ad24e1e1c7ed3dcc2b0e407 (04:58): that's sad
f97ed93c1ad24e1e1c7ed3dcc2b0e407 (04:58): :D
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (04:58): Why don't you do it?

f97ed93c1ad24e1e1c7ed3dcc2b0e407 (04:59): does sun provide archives of older commands?

24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (05:00): All the stupid GUI management tools, for instance.
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (05:01): And then there's the application servers.
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (05:01): slowroth, older commands all pretty much work they provide  API and ABI compatilibity back to  version 2.5.1   sunOs
c02048e82d3d496856ed9481b4012c35 (05:02): java swing is nice

f97ed93c1ad24e1e1c7ed3dcc2b0e407 (05:03): jamesd: thanks. i am particularly interested in OS features and tools, like ZFS, zones, DTrace, file system snapshots and similar. i would like to find out what features are introduced in which OS version.
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (05:03): slowroth: Those are all 10.
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (05:04): slowroth,  zfs was update 2,  dtrace   solaris FCS,  zones  FCS
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (05:04): snapshots were a feature of ZFS
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (05:04): ZFS still isn't quite stable.
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (05:05): Meriwether, dude, its listed as stable and has had few bugs since it was shipped, none are considered show stoppers.
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (05:05): I hear tales of nastiness, jamesd.
f97ed93c1ad24e1e1c7ed3dcc2b0e407 (05:06): these are just examples. i would like to know the same for jumpstart, webstart, cde, and so on.  something like a feature list for an os release.
